meanings.definition: A person, animal, or plant with an unusual physical abnormality.
meanings.sent1: The circus had a freak with two heads.
meanings.sent2: The two-headed snake was a freak of nature.
meanings.sent3: The freak plant in the garden always surprised visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to speak multiple languages was a freak among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The freak in the museum was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A sudden and odd change in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: His sudden outburst was a real freak at the party.
meanings.sent2: The freak in the weather caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The cat's freak of chasing its tail always made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The freak in the movie plot twist left everyone stunned.
meanings.sent5: The freak in her hairstyle made heads turn.

meanings.definition: To become very excited or emotional.
meanings.sent1: She would freak out whenever she saw a spider.
meanings.sent2: Don't freak if you hear a loud noise; it's just thunder.
meanings.sent3: I always freak when I see a clown at the circus.
meanings.sent4: The kids would freak with joy when the ice cream truck arrived.
meanings.sent5: He tends to freak over little things, like losing his keys.
